APP.AUTH.LOGIN.ALERT.ADVANTAGE_INFO.MSG: A user account on our page enables you to share your own configuration snippets. It also allows us to give additional permissions to users (moderative abilities). To be an active member of our community, you should definitely have an account and share your own snippets!

APP.ENTRIES.CREATE.LABEL.HOWDOESITWORK:
This form allows you to share a new configuration snippet. On the top you have to enter some information about the snippet, while on the bottom you get a chance to enter the actual snippet. In the list of formats you find plugins of which you can select one that fits (or sounds like it fits) your needs. We suggest you to use the ini, ni or yajl plugin if possible. If you cannot find a suitable plugin, then use the line plugin instead, it will basically store your snippet line by line as plain text.

Please be aware that you cannot change the fields on the top right (organization, application, scope and slug) later on.
The configuration snippet has been stored successfully. Please check if the import has not caused any issues. In case something is wrong, simply edit the snippet!

APP.ENTRIES.FORM.ALTTEXT.APPLICATION.HIN: What is the name of the application you want to share a configuration snippet for? In case of an Apache Tomcat webserver snippet, you should use 'tomcat' here.
APP.ENTRIES.FORM.ALTTEXT.ORGANIZATION.HI: Which organization builds the application you want to paste a snippet for? If you would like to share a snippet for the Apache Tomcat webserver for example, you could use either 'apache' or the reverse URL 'org.apache'.
APP.ENTRIES.FORM.ALTTEXT.SCOPE.HINT: The scope of a configuration should contain the version of the application (e.g. 'v1'). Additionally, it may contain the name of the configuration file in question, if multiple of these files exist for the application. The structure should be '(version)[.component]', e.g. 'v7.server.xml' for a Tomcat 7 server.xml configuration file.
APP.ENTRIES.FORM.ALTTEXT.SLUG.HINT: The slug is the last part of the unique identifier of a snippet. Normally it is automatically generated from the snippet title, but in case it is already used or you simply want to define your own slug, you can do so by enabling the input field.
APP.ENTRIES.FORM.ALTTEXT.SLUG.MANUALLY: By enabling this input field, you can define the slug yourself.
APP.ENTRIES.FORM.LABEL.CONFIRMLICENSE: By submitting the snippet you confirm that you have the rights to share the snippet and that you agree to making it available under our BSD license.

APP.GLOBAL.TITLE: ElektraInitiative
APP.HOME.HEADLINE.HOWITWORKS: Want to see how it works?
APP.HOME.HEADLINE.SLOGAN.SECOND: Elektra - the configuration framework for everyone
APP.HOME.HEADLINE.SLOGAN.THIRD: Elektra's core is fast, without dependencies, cross-platform, and all parts are 100% free software (BSD licensed).
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.1.DETAILS: Elektra stores configuration in a global, hierarchical key database. Mount configuration files into the hierarchy, safely edit configuration, and introspect current settings. kdb (1) provides easy access.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.1.HEADLINE: Global Configuration Database
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.2.DETAILS: Nearly all functionality of Elektra is implemented in plugins which can be combined to powerful functionality. Declaratively specify your favourite configuration format, default settings, and validation for your application!
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.2.HEADLINE: Extendability
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.3.DETAILS: Flexibly change between many common and important configuration formats: JSON, INI, XML, and even special configuration files like /etc/hosts and many others using Augeas. Tip: export, import, and 3-way merge is available, too.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.3.HEADLINE: Human-readable Configuration Files
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.4.DETAILS: Automate configuration tasks with powerful tools, check from which file an applications will receive settings, surf through configuration with GUIs, and notify other applications about configuration changes.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.4.HEADLINE: Batteries Included
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.5.DETAILS: Validate configuration immediately on changes, eliminate your configuration duplicates with the help of symbolic links or compute configuration parameters from other configuration values.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.5.HEADLINE: Configuration Specification
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.6.DETAILS: Make maintenance of your application easier and utilize all of Elektra's features by elektrification of your application. We have written a tutorial for you, which explains how to do that!
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.6.HEADLINE: Elektrify your Application
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.7.DETAILS: The Elektra core is written without external dependencies and with high regard to good performance.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.7.HEADLINE: Fast Without Dependencies
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.8.DETAILS: Thanks to all components being licensed under the BSD license, the Elektra project comprises only of free software.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.8.HEADLINE: 100% Free Software
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.9.DETAILS: Elektra strives to eliminate cross-platform related issues and is therefore suitable for all systems.
APP.HOME.LABEL.KEYFACT.9.HEADLINE: Cross-platform
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.1.DETAILS: You need help in developing a custom plugin? You want move unmaintained configuration code to us? Check out the plugin tutorial! Make sure to report an issue before: we can help or maybe even do it for you.
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.1.HEADLINE: Develop Custom Plugins
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.2.DETAILS: Of course you can use Elektra also outside a C or C++ environment. Have a look at our language bindings! You can even write plugins in Java, Python, and Lua.
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.2.HEADLINE: Use Elektra outside C/C++
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.3.DETAILS: Of course we can! An initiative like Elektra asks periodically for decisions! We welcome everyone to join the discussions!
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.3.HEADLINE: Can you Elaborate on the Why?
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.4.DETAILS: This website does not only contain the news and documentation around Elektra. It does also comprise a service that allows for sharing, searching, converting and downloading of configuration snippets in various formats. To search for a snippet, use the search bar at the top of the page. Uploading new snippets requires an account, which you can register here. All snippets have the BSD license and are available in different formats in a git repository.
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.4.HEADLINE: Sharing of Configuration Snippets
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.5.DETAILS: Utilize Elektra's code generator to generate type-safe configuration access code based on the same specification as used for validation.
APP.HOME.LABEL.ORIENTATION.5.HEADLINE: Code Generation
APP.HOME.LABEL.TOOL.OTHERS.DETAILS: Also other applications like the KDE KolorManager already use Elektra! Elektra is available in most distributions like Fedora, Gentoo, Arch Linux, Debian, Ubuntu, Openwrt, OpenSuse, PLDLinux, Linux Mint, and LEDE.
APP.HOME.LABEL.TOOL.OTHERS.HEADLINE: Other Applications
APP.HOME.LABEL.TOOL.QTGUI.DETAILS: Elektra offers a GUI based on Qt Quick. It simplifies common tasks and offers easy access to the key database itself. A description for the GUI tool can be found here.
APP.HOME.LABEL.TOOL.QTGUI.HEADLINE: Graphical User Interface
APP.HOME.LABEL.TOOL.WEBGUI.DETAILS: The Web GUI will allow for remote configuration of systems. Besides the configuration of single systems, it will also feature cluster configuration.
APP.HOME.LABEL.TOOL.WEBGUI.HEADLINE: Upcoming: Web GUI
